title: Good, but automatic location names are odd
comment: Works great, but the location chosen in automatic mode is displayed in a strange, non-standard format, i.e. {obscure rural location}, {county name}. Why can't it simply display the city name only, like every other location-aware app?

title: Location names are bad.
comment: Still trying to figure out how my city is named in this widget (living in Mar del Plata, Argentina). When I set auto location it works like a charm, It even tells me where it is getting the info from (Balneario Torreon del Monje, Gral. Pueyrredon, which is accurate to my real location), but when I try to manually imput that location it doesnt show up. Please fix the location names.

title: Great looking icons :)
comment: Works very well but sometimes the weather status doesn't update itself & you end up refreshing it manually by simply tapping the weather icon. Apart from that it looks & works great... It has 4 different sets of weather icons that'll suit everyone. I highly recommend this extension. Galaxy S4
Not refreshing

title: Not showing "feels like"
comment: The extension looks good, lots of customization options, but the whole reason I got it is because I want the "feels like" temperature, and that's not showing up. I live in a city that's very humid in the summer and very windy in the winter, so it's really important to have the "feels like" temperature. I've tried both services but neither one shows it. Any idea why?  Will update to 5 starts if I can get this to work.
Good

The developer should set a time limit on this.

EDIT: so it unlocks the phone and forces you to the home screen.

title: Very good app, but...
comment: You don't need GPS level location accuracy to tell me the weather around me which doesn't change at a street level granularity. Can you please update the app to a more coarse location request ping?

The app currently uses mostly Network location, but to accommodate some people I left the option to use GPS. I also added an option in the latest version 2.1 to use only Network location.

Thanks!

title: Great

I had forgotten a line break at the end, Version 2.0 fixes this ;) Hope you like it!

title: Offers nothing new
comment: Nothing that the default 'weather'  extention doesn't do.

They offer the same base feature but my extension is a lot more customizable and offers more detail than the stock one (more detailed forecasts, wind data, humidity data, more icons, etc). Maybe you could take a look again ;) But if you only want a simple weather extension I understand.

title: Great
comment: Great but last few updates have been giving me the wrong location when set to auto. Its giving me a location that does not exist in my state. EDIT: it seems to be only happening when i'm on wifi. the location works fine on 3G. Dash clock weather and eye in the sky extensions both show the correct location on wifi. Only happening on this app
Do you experience this problem in other location aware apps?
Excellent

title: Please add COLOR icons!
comment: No complaints but missing color weather icons... Add this please. Nice app :)
Sadly, due to the way DashClock works I can't use colored icons; DashClock automatically applies a white filter on top of the icons.

title: Add a Long touch action?
comment: It would be nice to have add a long tap/touch action. I would like to start barometer+ on a single short tap/touch and refresh weather info on a long tap/touch.  I see: Long tap does not work... that makes sense :-)   So how about a double tap to allow a second functionality??
Sadly I can't implement a long touch action since this is a widget. Long pressing the extension would only let you move the widget.
Really good

title: Simply doesn't work
comment: Won't update. When I click it, I get "Unfortunately, Better Weather has stopped."  Update: Developer is very helpful, and this seems to be an issue that only I am experiencing. Will give 4 stars until further notice.

I noticed some users that experienced this problem, I ran some tests and was able to replicate it myself. This should be fixed in version 1.4, it is already submitted and will be live in a couple hours! Thanks for the feedback!
